title: I dont understand why penalties for dodging in ranked are so high
body:
Hey guys,

I'm at silver rank right now in soloQ and many times at champ select i have to dodge because i see that my team mates choose only squishy champions or start to flame in team chat, while enemy team composition is clearly better with 2 or 3 tanky champs.

I feel obligated to dodge to avoid a free loose because consequences of loosing are too high to risk it.

But when i do i get 15 LP and 30 min penalty every time, well not the 1st time of the day but i dont want to play only 1 ranked game a day.

So I dont understand why are penalties this high for dodging a game. To avoid having too much people doing it and so making it harder to find a match? I prefer waiting longer to have a balanced matchup rather than having a 1 sided game, one way or another.

Can someone enlight me please?

replies.body: Because it would be abusable. Then you will see everyone complaining about everyone dodging so freely and games never happening.

I disagree. If you reduce penalties then yes there would be more dodging and more waiting time to find a game. But never happening is wrong. It would just take more time.

Look in real life people playing a team sport like football or such, you dont force players to play together because that wouldnt work. It doesnt mean there are no teams.

Do you play many sports??

Also don't take "never happening" to the extreme, it just means it's going to take so much longer, and that waiting is what's going to make people complain.

Another huge difference is that lack of maturity the league community holds compared to Real life sport added with the time real sports teams spend together vs a few people who just met and don't give any type of care about the others in this game.



it's a litteral set up for 15min+ queues in bronze, im sure bronze will have longer average queues than challenger.
